repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.title: Pending stuff for 8.0

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body:

issue.title: Move away from parsing/serializing annotations

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body: The provider still has old-style annotation implementations with objects which know how to serialize and parse themselves from strings. Clean this up.

issue.title: Dots in the schema name causes ArgumentException while creating a collation

repository.name: efcore.pg
repository.description: Entity Framework Core provider for PostgreSQL

issue.body:
Hi!

We would like to speed up our case-insensitive queries using collations. We are using `HasCollation()` in `OnModelCreating()`. But the problem is that our schema names include dots, which causes _ArgumentException_:

https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/blob/5aa5336d032c725ce6c1c05509642ce168de6e0c/src/EFCore.PG/Metadata/PostgresCollation.cs#L134

Is using a different separator in your plans?

Thanks in advance!
